utterance.speaker: LADY
utterance.content: Mr. Randall? They're here.

utterance.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
utterance.content: $52 million includes over $6 million already issued pursuant to the over-allotment option.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: When can we close?

utterance.speaker: OLIVER
utterance.content: It would be subject to regulatory approval in both Toronto and...

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I didn't say, "how," Oliver. I said, "when." What?

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: You sure this is a direction you want to go, Roy? This would move us from energy service into energy...

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: You don't think oil's going up?

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: Well of course it's going to go up. The question is when.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: The question is always when, and if we wait until the deal makes sense to everyone else, we're going to be waiting in line behind everyone else.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: All I'm saying is...

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: The same cover-your-ass crap you always say. We're going to have to wrap this up. I've got to go.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Upstairs. Get the regulators on it. I want to close by the end of the month.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: Come on, Roy. There are ten other items on the agenda.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Which will have to wait until next week.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: You can't drag us all out of the office, get halfway through, and then just kick us out.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Yeah, I can.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: The antibiotic treatment had no effect. Both the fever and the pain are getting worse, which means it's not clostridium difficile.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: But you said that was the only diagnosis that made sense.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: It was. We need to get him to a hospital.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Dad? I don't want to go.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I know, buddy. But we may need to.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Am I going to die?

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Well, I just do. And I'm always right, aren't I?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I want House.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I understand, but I told you Dr. House isn't available. Dr...

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Call him. Tell him I'll have a private jet pick him up from whatever island...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He isn't on vacation. Dr. Foreman's one of our best doctors.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Is House in jail?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No. Foreman is currently working with two of House's most veteran associates.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Rehab?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No. Mr. Randall, your son will be in good hands.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: My son... has already been in good hands, and he's still dying. I'm through dealing with good. I want the best, and everyone I've asked says that's House. So unless he's dead, comatose, or insane, I want him treating my son, today.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You could have said no, in good conscience.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The kid'll still be Foreman's patient, but his dad wants you making the decisions.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Then he's not my patient. You want to give me none of the responsibility and all of the liability?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which means I get... Oh, cool.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Don't let him do anything crazy.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: When is he getting his license back so we can stop playing this game?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe never. This game is fun.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You also need to prepare President Dibala's case for this week's morbidity and mortality conference.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh... Unfortunately I'm overdue a mani-pedi appointment.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Not you. Foreman's department.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, right. Well, he's got all the time in the world.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We made the wrong call, he died. There's nothing to present.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It obviously garnered a lot of curiosity.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: And we don't have more important things to do than satisfy everyone's idle curiosity?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's not idle. The question of how we deal with two possible diagnoses whose treatments are contraindicated is worth discussing.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Abdominal pain increasing in severity and frequency, fever, dehydration, diarrhea, weight loss.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Mom died from kidney failure caused by type one diabetes, which has been ruled out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 17 doctors. Everything's been ruled out. Which means we have to re-rule out. Get a new history and physical. Unless that's crazy, boss.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You been out of the country or on any recent camping trips?

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: No camping. But we were in Montreal back in January.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: We went to see the NHL all-star game for my birthday.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Awesome.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Where's Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: In his office. He's really more of a decider than a do-er. He's decided we should start over. Never know what previous doctors may have missed. Like this. Does that hurt more when I push there?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm not sure.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Just keep it clean, simple. We did a test that called into question our initial diagnosis, so we changed our mind.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And if they ask how the test was done?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why would they do that? It's a routine lab test.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Routine lab tests don't involve blood you stole from a corpse to trick me into giving the guy the wrong treatment.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yes, and if you brought that up, it'd certainly make for a lively debate about the morality of murdering murderers. But since you burned the only evidence of that.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: To cover for you, not me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You're protected. The decision was a coin flip. There was no right or wrong answer. The body's underground, 8,000 miles away. Nobody can prove anything.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That room will be filled, not because of a coin flip, not because of the patient, but because House's department screwed up. They're going to be like sharks in a chum-filled swimming pool, and there's no way I'm jumping in unless I'm in a steel cage.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So what do you want?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I want to know you have everything covered.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Got what covered?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We're just reviewing the Dibala case. Making sure we didn't miss anything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We didn't. Except of course the thing that killed him.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's constipated. Physical revealed a mass in his abdomen, so I repeated the X-ray. Old one was clean. New one shows that his colon's almost completely impacted.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Obstruction would explain the pain. You think they just screwed up the old X-ray?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Hirschsprung's?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's a congenital disorder of the nerves in the colon. Very rare in a child your son's age. Most doctors would never think of it.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: And you came up with this?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's House's idea.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We need a barium enema and biopsy to confirm.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Let me guess. It tastes really bad, but it's going to make me feel a lot better.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Actually, you're not going to taste it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You should try searching for "Misty May digs for gold." Make sure you put it in quotes.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I'm making travel plans. Just need to get away. Have some time to myself. You getting the hint?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So that's it? You're done with your little experiment with Foreman?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It wasn't an experiment. It was a relationship. You may want to look into the difference. I'm glad you're better, House. I actually liked working for you. But I'm not coming back.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good. 'Cause if you came back, Foreman would try and save the relationship and he'd give up being the boss.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Are you here to try to save my relationship with Foreman?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: God no. Trying to save MY relationship with Foreman. Right now I'm Kobe, playing the game I love, however the hell I want. Phil Jackson has to listen to everyone else bitch about it. Enjoy Cabo.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I'm going to Thailand.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Really? Interesting.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Good-bye, House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good-bye Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Last week, yesterday, today.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I can't believe it. He's pain-free for the first time in months. He's even hungry.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: I'm starving.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We're still waiting for the biopsy results, but obviously it's a good sign.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're going to want to take it slow. Don't try to regain all the lost weight in one meal.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The abdomen feels normal, but it looks bigger.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Jack, are you feeling... Jack? Hey, Jack, you okay?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Right eye's fixed. Lateral rectus palsy. He's seizing. Need five milligrams of diazepam.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: What, what's happening?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Hold down his head and turn off the lights. I need to see his optic disk.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Heart rate is elevated.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Come on, hold his head.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: I'm trying.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Wait! Where, where's House?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: OK, Mr. Randall, we need you to step back.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: His optic disk is swollen. He's got intracranial hypertension. Furosemide. 20 milligrams IV.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If we could intubate him, we could hyperventilate him...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Need five more milligrams of diazepam. DC the monitors. Push 500 milligrams phenytoin.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We can't push that much.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We got to relieve the pressure or his brain could herniate.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: 50 milligrams of phenytoin.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Page Chase. Tell him to meet us in the OR.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We need your consent.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: What's happening to him?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Pressure in his skull's too high. If we don't reduce it, it could irrevocably damage his brain.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: But he was just talking. He was smiling.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We need to drill burr holes.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Drill into his head?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Phenytoin's not working. Paralyze him. Three milligrams pancuronium. Then intubate and hyperventilate.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Where's House?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House isn't here. Do we have your consent? Do we have your consent? Ready? One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Injecting three milligrams of pancuronium.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Look at the monitors. He's still seizing. We need to do this now. Go.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Electrical seizure activity's stopped.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Intracranial pressure's declining. Come on. Keep going. Pressure's down to eight.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'll go tell the dad.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He hasn't had any more seizures, and cytological examination of the subdural fluid showed no abnormalities.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't usually see brain damage after a rectal biopsy.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He was fine after the procedure. No headaches. No mental status change. It wasn't anything we did.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's not just his brain. He's continuing to build up fluid in his abdominal cavity as well as the Dura. We've inserted shunts to drain it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Got to be some sort of systemic infection.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not after spending the last week getting pumped full of IV antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Notice anything odd about the shape of the fluid collection?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, God, it's... The Virgin Mary.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The edge should be tapered, lens shaped.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Unless... The Dural layer was already separated from the brain when the fluid started to build up. Get a Dural biopsy to confirm brain cancer. Nice catch.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Bangkok. Flight 799.

utterance.speaker: CAB DRIVER
utterance.content: Wow. Bangkok, that sounds awesome. How long?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Not sure yet. Luckily I have a friend who's staying at my place, taking care of my dog. He's really big, so he needs a lot of exercise. Remy Hadley. H-a-d-l-e-y.

utterance.speaker: CAB DRIVER
utterance.content: What, you think I'm going to rob the place?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: CAB DRIVER
utterance.content: In case you haven't noticed, I have a job.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Look, I'm sorry. I don't know you. You're either honest or dishonest. I figured the safer choice is to...

utterance.speaker: CAB DRIVER
utterance.content: Is to treat a stranger like an ass. Nice way to live your life... bitch.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I said I'm sorry. Oh, hello. I was wondering if there were any business class seats open that I could use my miles to upgrade to.

utterance.speaker: CAB DRIVER
utterance.content: I don't know you, but I assumed I could trust you. Welcomed you in my car.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Okay, you're a saint. That's impossible. I confirmed my reservation last night. So rebook it. Well, obviously it was a mistake on your end, not mine. No, I'm on my way to the airport right now.

utterance.speaker: CAB DRIVER
utterance.content: They didn't believe you, huh?

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Brain cancer?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We should know for sure by the morning.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Our luck just keeps getting worse, huh?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Treatment options are getting better every day. There's no visible mass, so even if the biopsy comes back positive, we've caught it early.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Oh, so you're telling me this is good news?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm saying we will do whatever we can.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Right. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I've got to go. Foreman needs more help with the M prep.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Okay, I'll come up and help after I finish the biopsy.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We can handle it. I'll see you at home later.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If you're here, I might as well be.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Go home. Get some rest. 'Cause I'm going to be waking you up as soon as I get home.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Stay out of my life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I know you canceled my reservation. You obviously saw me log in when you were spying on me in the coffee shop.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I was talking to you. I was spying on the milf in the running shorts.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I'm not coming back on the team.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't want you back on the team.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I cannot work for, with, or around Foreman.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which is why I don't want you back on the team. Now that you're out of the picture, he's better than ever, which is going to make me less miserable than ever, which is why neither of us gives a damn how, when, or on what island in the Bahamas you went to get from it all.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The Bahamas?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Costa Rica?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I told you Thailand.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I assumed you were lying, because it would have been idiotic of you to tell me truth. Yet another reason I have no use for you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We've got a problem. When Cameron sent Dibala's blood to the lab, she specifically asked for the anticentromere antibodies test.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The printout they sent you included just the anticentromere antibodies, but the lab also did a full blood panel.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So, I'm not an idiot. I obviously made sure the cadaver I got the sample from had the same blood type.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You apparently didn't check its cholesterol.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: How far off?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Dibala didn't die of high cholesterol. Why would anyone even bother to compare the two reports?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The same reason I did. Because they're looking for anything we might have screwed up.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We could claim the blood analyzer broke.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We can't. Cameron documented that it was perfectly calibrated when she did the test.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So the numbers are off, it's weird. Who cares? If it comes up, just act surprised like it's some irrelevant curiosity.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I can't do this. I can't go in there and stack lie upon lie. You've got to figure out a way to explain this.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Missed you this morning.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry. I needed to get in early. I didn't want to wake you.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I thought you did want to wake me. At least that's what you said last night.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm out of here.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No, no. I got the biopsy results. It's not cancer.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How can so much be wrong with nothing being wrong?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Since when has cancer been considered nothing?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I just said it's not cancer. The cell morphologies were all normal.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And so are the most recent CT scans.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On the other hand, adenocarcinoma of the stomach would cause pain, constipation, nutritional deficiencies that could cause seizures.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And wouldn't show on a CT.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You were right about the cancer, just wrong about the place. Continue to say nothing if you agree.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Go scope him. Get another set of biopsies.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'd get canceling her ticket, if you then showed up with two more to somewhere better.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or showed up at all. But how does just ruining her plans get her to agree to yours?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You talking about Thirteen? Where's she going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, nowhere this week, thanks to you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I didn't stop her. I'm not going to stop her. I've already done all I could. Now all I can do is move on.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think... I actually believe you. If you're telling the truth, you're even more rational than I... Well, not more. Then again more sane. You're going to be a good boss, boss.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I told you there's nothing wrong.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: There's obviously something wrong and I'm not even saying we need to talk about it right now. I just don't see why you have to deny it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Now you're denying you're denying.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No, I'm denying that there's anything to deny.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Robert, you can't do this. You can't hide things from me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There's a problem with the Dibala M The HDL numbers on one of his early blood panels don't match a later panel.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's weird.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah... It's no big deal. Cholesterol didn't have anything to do with his death, but, you know, after being let go from Mercy and then that thing with Thirteen's drug trial, Foreman's paranoid about people questioning the way he handled the case.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Well that's ridiculous. If anything, Foreman should be feeling secure. He's the one who had the right diagnosis. We're the ones who talked him out of it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I know. Don't tell him I told you. He doesn't want to show any signs of weakness, especially now that House is claiming he wants him to stay in charge.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: So it's still cancer? It's just somewhere else?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's what we're looking for, but it would explain all the symptoms and all the normal test and imaging studies.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Got biopsies of the mucosa and the sub-mucosa, moving towards the pylorus.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: It's my fault.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Adenocarcinomas aren't caused by diet or environmental factors.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I inherited a $10 million pipeline business when I was 24. By the time I was 30, it was worth over a billion. Since then, I have been involved in over 50 deals that make that first one look like a loser. Everything I do, everything I touch turns to gold... Except my family. First, my wife. And now... my son. This is my fault. It's karma.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's obviously not true.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He's seizing again.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Get the scope out. Need five milligrams diazepam.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: How's the ICP?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's... Eight. But the shunt's open and clear. This isn't intracranial pressure.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Then what the hell is it?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Seizures stopped, but he hasn't regained consciousness. No sign of any masses in his stomach or esophageal lining and he's still accumulating subdural and peritoneal fluid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And every time we look to see where it's coming from, he starts seizing.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You think we're setting this off?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think something is.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: One of his stomach biopsies shows an arteriole partially occluded.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: But with no abnormality in the other layers and no evidence of a cellular inflammatory reaction.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's definitely not cancer.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Then it has to be some sort of infection.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We already ruled out infection.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Only because he was treated for it and got worse.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Seems like a sound reason.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Unless it's a drug-resistant strain.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Drug-resistant strain of what? Bacterial cultures, viral serologies, ANA and a NCA were all negative.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Everything's negative. We obviously missed something.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Maybe the seizures aren't a new symptom. They're an old one.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No doctor noticed a thrashing kid?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Abdominal epilepsy. The seizures would just look like pain until it spread to his motor cortex.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It wouldn't explain the fevers.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Protein malnutrition can cause fevers and nothing causes malnutrition like excruciating stomach pain that gets worse every time you eat.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'd be a lot more certain if it was my idea, but it's the best we got.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Start him on gabapentin. Hook him up to an intracranial EEG for continuous monitoring.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I gave him statins.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If they ask about the cholesterol, just say I prescribed a statin and forgot to put it in the chart.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You want to solve a problem in the records by creating another problem in the records?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's not a problem with the records. It's a problem with my record keeping. There's no way anyone can prove me wrong.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How'd you get access to the statins? You going to get someone in the pharmacy to confess to yet another record-keeping problem?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I saw an open cart. Just took it.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why would you steal a drug you could just as easily ask for?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: 'Cause I'm trying to get you off the hook.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: A story that raises more questions than it answers only puts the hook deeper down my throat. It's all right. I'll handle it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: By telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The truth is I don't have the time, I'm not in the mood, and I don't see the point.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You don't want to do the M because you're not in the mood?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: This kid is dying and I've got House trying to push all his responsibilities onto me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: They're not his responsibilities. They're yours. You're the one who wanted to be in charge.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I wanted to be in charge, not a figurehead.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Then do the M It's all yours.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You want me to get flogged? For what? So you can have an academic debate about a diagnostic dilemma no one's ever going to face again?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What the hell's going on here?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I just don't want to do the M

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Did it work?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not even close.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just waiting for whatever is about to go wrong.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Thirteen called.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She have a theory that makes more sense than abdominal epilepsy?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She said someone hacked into her email account and canceled an airline reservation. I'm guessing Foreman.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Really? You're accusing Foreman, not me? Cool.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You really want Foreman to stay in charge of the team?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Makes sense. He loves power, and I love puzzles.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You love power and puzzles.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: True. But when I had them both... It wasn't Foreman.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He said he's moved on.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: And you believe him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I believe that he believes it. Looks like it's time for me to get off the bench. What's up?

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Are you Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I understand you're a big fan. I'll have my guy send over a signed glossy.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Continuous EEG shows no interictal spikes. It's not abdominal epilepsy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You paged me to tell me what it's not?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I paged you to show you this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That... I did not expect.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Well what the hell is that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Darn it. I knew I should have stayed outside. Fantasy's always much better than the reality.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: You think this is a joke? That's my son, he's dying, and not one of you seem to have the slightest clue why.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know. That's why it's so interesting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fever, stomach pain, seizures, peritoneal and subdural fluid collection and now spots.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Could be an allergic reaction to one of his meds.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That suddenly developed eight hours after he started the meds?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If it's not cancer or infection, it has to be autoimmune. Systemic lupus complicated by a CNS vasculitis would explain the rash, fever, ascites...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: CNS vasculitis would cause a stiff neck along with a headache.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And would've showed up on the Dural biopsy.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What about polyarteritis nodosa? It can occur in kids.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Except you can't have arteritis without inflammation.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Okay, you come up with something better.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There was some inflammation in the skin biopsy, plus he's got elevated diastolic pressure.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's barely elevated, which you'd expect given the number of procedures he's undergone.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well, barely is more than not barely.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not my decision. But if it was, I'd say start him on prednisone and get a testicular biopsy. If he's going to have any real inflammation, it'll be down there.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Cameron and I will do it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why? It was Chase's idea.

utterance.speaker: FORMEAN
utterance.content: Kid's father is not going to be happy about a fourth set of biopsies, and you've got a better rapport.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What's really going on here? You need Chase to help you over-prep for the M?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Then say so. Don't be a child.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is it on his penis? Kid's rash?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Means it's most likely affecting the small blood vessels. That's why we didn't see any inflammation on the biopsies. It's not polyarteritis. It's Degos disease. I'll do it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your son has Degos disease. Causes micro blood vessels in the brain, skin, GI tract to break down, clot off. It sometimes manifests early on with atrophic papules on the penis. In your son's case, we don't know why, but they came much later.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: What's the treatment?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There isn't one. It's incurable.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: You're wrong. You've already been wrong a bunch of times.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We've rechecked the biopsies. It's definitely Degos. I'm sorry. I wish there was something we could do.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: How long?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not much longer.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A day at the most.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: All right, great.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Unless it's life or death, it's going to have to wait.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's about Dibala.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, let me rephrase. Unless it's a current life...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Foreman can't present the case at the M

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I know you guys are busy, but he's just going to have to suck it up and make the time.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's not the time.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The anticentromere antibodies test. The test that caused us to change the treatment from blastomycosis to scleroderma... It wasn't...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Wasn't what?

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy? They need you in the pediatric ICU.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Who's they?

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: I don't know. But I think they're lawyers.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: If you guys screwed something up, just come clean. It's not going to be that bad.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: With all due respect, you don't know what's at stake here.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: You need to stop him! He's about to ruin his life.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Like you give a damn about my life.

utterance.speaker: OLIVER
utterance.content: Roy, he's right. You're borrowing money to buy options that are already out of the money. Even you won't be able to cover the losses. Your house, cars, bank accounts. You'll lose everything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's the point. The billionaire thinks that the gods will treat him better if he's broke. I suggested he give it to me...

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: There's got to be some sort of balance. You can't have all the good fortune in just one area of your life. It's not how the world's supposed to work.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who said the world is supposed to work?

utterance.speaker: OLIVER
utterance.content: Don't just wipe everything out. Put your assets in a trust. Give it to a charity.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I can't get anything back.

utterance.speaker: OLIVER
utterance.content: He's insane.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's irrational. So are most people. Unfortunately it doesn't make him insane.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: If he signs that paper, he's not only going to destroy his own life, but the lives of thousands of people who rely on this company to make a living. If he is insane, we will sue this hospital...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Mr. Randall... I know you're upset. But you shouldn't make a decision like this right now. Give it some time.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: My son doesn't have any time.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Your son's dying from an incurable disease, not bad karma.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: No. He's not dying. It's not going to happen, I'm not going to let it.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: Roy, please!

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I can't let him die.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: People don't get what they deserve, they just get what they get. There's nothing any of us can do about it.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: Deliver it. Or I'll make sure you end up the ones with nothing.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Call a code. He's flat lining.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're welcome. For what?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: For thinking I was worth breaking the law to keep around.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That's just the way I am, but still don't know what you're talking about.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Cuddy had IT trace all the IP addresses who've logged in to my email account. There were two. Mine and yours.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Obviously House decided he needs you more than he's...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I already asked House.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: And he'd certainly never lie.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No, he'd lie. Except he wants me gone. And he'd do a lot better job of lying than you just did.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Really? It was that bad?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No, actually. But it doesn't matter anymore. Why? Because of House or Foreman?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're good for both of them, but Foreman's not my best friend.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: House will be fine.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Maybe. But with you on the team, he'd be better. He needs someone... Who doesn't need him. You're the only one he's never really been able to suck into his crazy House vortex. Keeps him grounded. His ego in check.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Why didn't you just come to me?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I figured you'd only stay if House asked... And I knew he would, eventually.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Bye Wilson.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: This is a great job. Maybe even better now that House is at least trying to have real relationships with people. I said "trying."

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It doesn't matter.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The job you love doesn't matter? Don't throw it all away just because of a bad break-up.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Bye Wilson.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I just confessed. I told Thirteen I was the one who canceled the plane ticket.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You mean why did I confess or why did I do it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know you didn't do it, so I guess the first.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You want her to stay because you want her back or because Foreman does?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why would I care what Foreman wants?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Because you're not as big a jerk as everyone thinks.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes I am.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No you're not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I just made a $10,000 short sale on a stock I know is going to crash because of what I saw a grief-stricken dad do on his son's deathbed.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No you didn't.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes I did.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You are a jerk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's making a mistake.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So you did it for her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's a good doctor.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So you did it for you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not the one in charge anymore.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So you did it for Foreman?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's a smoking hot, newly single bisexual.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why don't you just admit that you like having her around? She's good for you. You need her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I was born with a heart three sizes too small.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No you weren't.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes I...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He still alive?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good. Start him on heparin and IV immunoglobulin.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: For Degos?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The cardiac arrest wasn't just a "everything goes to hell in a hand basket" arrest. It was a coronary event. Coronaries are large vessels. Means it can't be Degos.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: But the biopsies confirmed...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Obstructed blood vessels. But they can't be obstructed because of Degos. Means it's primary antiphospholipid syndrome.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope. But I will be if he responds to the heparin and the immunoglobulin. By the way, someone screwed over your girlfriend and she ran to me, Cuddy, and Wilson. Everyone but you. She's not over you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Or she is.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Where'd you find it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Find what?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The niacin bound chromium supplements. It was right on top of the file. You don't know about it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No. Been here all night.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: One of Dibala's previous docs was prescribing ultra high doses of niacin bound chromium to boost his HDL.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So it gives us something to point to. We can explain the wide variation between the HDL numbers. We're safe. We're covered. You really didn't request the info?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No. And obviously you didn't either. Which means...

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: It worked.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The medicine worked.

utterance.speaker: ROY
utterance.content: It worked.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: How'd you find it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fat old black guy. Knew he had to be taking something for his cholesterol.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: And what now?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not the boss.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You don't think I should be fired?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why? I doubt we'll ever be treating a genocidal dictator again. Better a murder than a misdiagnosis.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Whether you want to be in charge or not. You are and you always will be.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: 75-year-old African man presented to our hospital following a rapid onset of hemoptysis. He'd been fine prior to onset. No chest pain, fever, coughing, or chills...
